answers.answer: Hello Dear,Some of the possible causes of facial numbness could be peripheral neuropathy,diabetes,nerve compression,hypertension. You keep your blood sugar levels maintaines as increase in the levels leads to complications involing nerves,eyes and kindney.Consult your diabetologist and get your doses adjusted if there is hyperglycaemia.Best

question: i have recently noticed a numb feeling to my right side of my chin covering an area of about three square inches from under mylip to my chin and exactly half way across my to the centre. i have had this for about six weeks  , can you please help. i have also recently been diagnosed with diabetis.thank you gerald williams.
title: facial numbness
